text: Josephine Perenda (born 1903) was a Austrian track and field athlete, being active during the 1920s. She was specialized in the hurdles. She was national record holder and represented Austria internationally. ==Biography== Perenda was born in 1903. On 9 October 1927 she broke the national record in the 80 meters hurdles in Krak√≥w with a time of 14.3 seconds. This was 0.1 second faster of the old record by Hilde Lahr. Perenda represented Austria at multiple international competitions. ==References== Category:1903 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Austrian athletes Category:Hurdlers
title: Josephine Perenda
